name: Normatif zamirler
description: It's worth mentioning that pronouns ≠ gender. One can still be nonbinary while using pronouns that are congruent with (or opposite to) their gender assigned at birth.

name: Yarı normatif zamirler
description: Those pronouns have been in common use in normative English already, but recently they got a slightly different new usage: describing a single, specific person. If you want to link to plural “they”, use {/they,!5,Plural%20“they”=this link}.

name: Popüler neozamir
description: Unlike the other pronouns, which are officially recognised as “grammatically correct”, albeit used in a different meaning than we're used to, neopronouns are novel. Not being included in dictionaries doesn't make them any worse, though!

name: Diğer neozamir
description: These neopronouns are less often used than their more popular counterparts, but it doesn't make them any worse (and some of them are historically notable).  Some neopronouns' names are derived from the names of their creators. If your pronoun is not on the list, use the generator below!
